description: Presidential elections occur quadrennially in years evenly divisible by 4, on the first Tuesday after November 1. Presidential candidates from the major political parties usually declare their intentions to run as early as the spring of the previous calendar year before the election. The two major parties each nominate one candidate through a process of primary elections and nominating conventions during the election year. (source: Wikipedia) 20 candidates are considered as nominees as of July 2023, mostly Republican. Only two Democrats are currently challenging the incumbent president. Republican and Democrat party candidates must meet [FiveThirtyEight's criteria for being a major candidate](https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/whos-a-serious-candidate-for-the-republican-nomination-and-whos-just-dreaming). This dataset contains data on candidates and polling results. Updates and additional data will be added as the landscape develops. Note: Please see Version 3 of this dataset for coverage of the 2022 Congressional Mid-term Elections.
title: 2024 US Presidential Election Watcher
